origin: Middle English from Old French juge (noun), juger (verb), from Latin judex, judic-, from jus ‘law’ + dicere ‘to say’.

definitions.definition: A public official appointed to decide cases in a court of law.
definitions.example: The judges made this particular aspect of public policy and the judges are entitled to change it.

definitions.definition: Form an opinion or conclusion about.
definitions.example: it is hard to judge whether such opposition is justified
